Reviews.Title: “Old Town stop.”
Reviews.Author: Tim T
Reviews.Content: Great front desk, got us right into a very nice room. Good sized, seemed recently renovated though could use some new furniture. Location close to Old Town and Sea World was just what we wanted. Not noisy, good continental breakfast, a great place to stay for not too much money.

Reviews.Title: “very good value for the price”
Reviews.Author: joan c Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Excellent staff, exceptional value for the price, good location to public transport and Old Town (2 minute walk), safe to walk at night, free parking, free wireless, free continental breakfast(tea/cofeee/milk/juices/cereal/good selection of pastries/fruit/boiled eggs at weekends),cooked breakfast at a reasonable price, free internet & printing in the lobby, outdated but clean room with microwave & fridge. I will stay here the next time I am in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money!”
Reviews.Author: LyleN
Reviews.Content: This place only runs about $50 a night, so don't look for luxury. It is, however, clean and comfortable. The staff are very helpful and the location is great, right in Old Town, but off to the side away from the noise. Again, this is a sixties hotel, even a bit campy and historic, but not fancy, but is is great value for money and a nice place.

Reviews.Title: “Inexpensive motel right next to Old Town”
Reviews.Author: DesertFox_12
Reviews.Content: This motel, while inexpensive, is quite satisfactory. It is clean and just across the street from Old Town San Diego. There is ample parking off the street, so one doesn't have to worry about one's car. The breakfast, while just continental, is adequate; it is located in a restaurant setting so there is plenty of seating, unlike some other inexpensive motels that I have stayed in (where one can barely find a place to sit). There are good restaurants for lunch and dinner within easy walking distance; indeed one can walk all around Old Town San Diego and never have to use one's car.

Reviews.Title: “decent hotel but requires improvement(3.5 stars)”
Reviews.Author: wilddream w
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for the Christmas weekend and the day I checked in at night on Christmas eve and the person was not very friendly but gave the two rooms together as desired. Overall staff is very friendly and the breakfast is good and the server at the breakfast cafe was excellent( 5 stars for him). We found one roach in one of the rooms so i cannot give 4 stars.

Reviews.Title: “Inexpensive, clean, in order, the basics in the heart of Old Town”
Reviews.Author: phoenixdude1000
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 4 days. It's the basics. The furniture in my room was all old style, maybe 70's, but in good condition. Carpet appeared clean (it was a dark color). Bathroom was clean and in good condition. I slept in late a few times and although I had the Do Not Disturb sign on my doorknob, the maid called on two different days around 11:40AM to ask if I needed service. So it was an unrequested wake up call. I know the maid was trying to do her job but that only happens in lesser establishments. There are some big pluses: very inexpensive rates and it's located right in Old Town Downtown San Diego. And it's clean and in order. A short drive away there are tons of chain restaurants and stores and a liquor store or two. So if you just want to visit Old Town and you just need a clean place to crash for cheap, this is your place. Just don't sleep in real late or you'll get an unrequested wake up call.

Reviews.Title: “Unbeatable Price, Location”
Reviews.Author: Ode2travel
Reviews.Content: Why spend $$$ for a luxury hotel when you're probably not going to spend much time in it anyway? Don't let the retro 1960's look of this hotel fool you. The rooms are modest, but actually quite nicely remodeled. Mine was immaculate and fresh. The hotel has free high-speed wi-fi. There is also a free continental breakfast, or you can buy a full breakfast in their sit-down restaurant. Although I felt extremely safe in the area, it was nice to see policemen eating there daily. The front staff was cordial. Everything in Old Town is within walking distance, including the trolly system, which is easy to navigate. It can take you all the way to the border of Mexico. I play on staying there again this spring. Love the military discount!

Reviews.Title: “We loved it!!”
Reviews.Author: Maxi86
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 weeks in October and there is absolutely no complaint whatsoever! The rooms were cleaned promptly and properly, new towels each day, bathroom and toilet was bleached every morning and the cleaners were so friendly! The pool was clean and tested regularly! Reception staff were accommodating and understanding and had more patience with my daughter who has ADHD and special needs than I expected! The restaurant staff were great especially Louis. My daughter loved his cheese grills every morning! We had such a great time we are going again next year for a month! I would recommend this place to singletons, couples and families! Basically I would recommend this hotel to anyone!!

Reviews.Title: “Sorry I couldn't stay longer...”
Reviews.Author: Calligrl
Reviews.Content: I didn't expect the greatest hotel due to what I paid, but I would certainly stay here again. Regardless of how many stars, every hotel should have good customer service and clean rooms with everything working. That's what I got! Very friendly staff, clean room and althought there were a lot of traffic passing on the street next to the hotel, I didn't hear any noise. So... comparing apples to apples... this hotel is worth every penny!

Reviews.Title: “Best Value in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: paul m
Reviews.Content: After shopping around for 2 days I decided to give them a try. Pretty basic rooms but very clean. Beds were pretty comfy. Most important thing was good WiFi for work, it worked perfect and was FREE! Hightly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, And Fine for Sleeping”
Reviews.Author: jcborange
Reviews.Content: We were going down for a football game and was rarely in the room. If you want to spend a lot of time in the room maybe another hotel would be better. There is nothing wrong with Padre Trail Inn. The beds were fine, it was clean, and comfortable. It's directly up the street from the trolley stop. You can get on this and go downtown, Mission Valley, etc. You can walk a couple of blocks to the Old Town Historic District. There are many restaurants in the area and close. You don't have to pay for parking either. This is a plus in many areas now days. It's very economical. It reminded me of where we would stay growing up (basic).

Reviews.Title: “Great value for a great little place.”
Reviews.Author: AZNA1
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on our San Diego leg and it was quite a nice little spot. The people at reception were very good and gave excellent prompt service. The included breakfast as not too bad they had on offer the usual Cereals, pastries and juices but also offered a hot menu if you wanted to pay. The rooms were very clean and neat as were the bathrooms - the only down side if you get the room next to the "machinery room" where they wash all the housekeeping stuff then it if very noise at around 7:00am i think its around room 130 or 131 from memory. All in all it was a great place to stay in "Old town" as there were many gift and craft shops and many many mexican restaurants and bars, also close access to a market and the hop on hop off bus.

Reviews.Title: “Book this hotel if you dont find anything better in the area”
Reviews.Author: Albatross53
Reviews.Content: Hotell had friendly staff and clean rooms, the room included fridgerator and coffeeboiler. Walking distance from Old Town and Trolley station. Poor breakfast. As we European are used to this could not be called continental breakfast. No vedgetables or fruit in the morning. Two stones in the bottom of the pool. The resting beds in the pool area were dirty and were not cleaned in the 5 days we stayed. Booked the room 25 february to be safe get the best room when we arrived on Easter. The clerk said when we arrived that we got the last room, so we hade no advantage to book in forehand. Horrible smell in the room when we arrived in the evening. Unable to get the air conditioning to work. Had to sleep with the window open in the restroom. I left a note to the housekeeper not to close the window during daytime, but she closed it all time. Staying on second floor, so I doubt any thieves could get in there through the small restroom window. The housekeeper draw up the curtains in the room and left the sunshine get into the room, and warm up heat the room all day long. TV is too small and oldfashioned. Worth 0 USD. Thin walls made that we could hear a person that had a cold, couhing all night. The clerk made a wrong transaction, as we checked out. I prefer get a reciet in my hand when we checked in so I could have see this from the beginning and get it right from the beginning. Seems a bit unprofessional. They charged me tree times, but finally they changed it, so it got right. I prefered doors to the hotell area so just the hotellguests could get in to the area after checking in. It didnt feel safe to be in the hotell. / Eivor, travelling in U.S. for the first time

Reviews.Title: “Good location, service and price”
Reviews.Author: john7303
Reviews.Content: We stayed here while vising San Diago. This hotel fits our budget and it was a decent place to stay. The staff was friendly, helpful. Room was clean and comfortable. Good location if you want to see Seaworld, town or beaches.

Reviews.Title: “Not a place to get a good nights sleep”
Reviews.Author: SBinAZ
Reviews.Content: If you are an unemployed starving student like me than this place will probably work for you. I was in town visiting friends. Since the residences in SD are super tiny I just wanted my own place to shower and sleep. Check in was easy. The guy at the front desk was very nice. I pulled up to my room to find a truck full of guys sitting outside smoking and drinking, who were staying in the room next door to mine, I promptly went back to the front desk and asked for another room which was no problem, however it wasnâ€™t that far away from the first room. If I had been traveling with my boyfriend we wouldnâ€™t have made it 5 minutes in this place. My room was the second most run down hotel room Iâ€™ve ever stayed at. As soon as I walked in and put my stuff down I was on the phone trying to meet up with my friends ASAP. I also stayed out as late as possible so I would be too tired to care what I was coming back too. The bed was fine but Iâ€™m glad I brought extra pillows. The location is great as itâ€™s close to everything! I felt perfectly safe. Iâ€™m not a person who cares about dÃ©cor or other miniscule flaws; however, I do care about patches of black mold spores covering the bathroom ceiling, particularly when that ceiling is only about 6 feet tall. For some reason the ceiling in the shower is substantially shorter than the rest of the bathroom. My bf who is 6â€™4â€� wouldnâ€™t have fit in there. Iâ€™m 5â€™6â€� and the water hit me at my belly button I had to get on my knees to wash my hair. I also would have to shut the water off mid shower to let the tub drain. Also, if you are staying by yourself donâ€™t close the bathroom door all the way when you take a shower because the door tends to swell shut and you might get stuck in there for a little while :-/ I was also bit by ants while using the restroom. On my first morning I was awoken at 6:30 am to what I thought was an earthquake. The building was cracking, having lived in SD for 3 years I know what it sounds like, however, it turned out just to be the people above me. You can hear every footstep, when the shower comes on, when the dresser doors open, when the front door closes, and when housekeeping is vacuuming. My bf has worked at a hotel front desk for years and when a hotel is half empty, like this one was, he never puts people on top of each other or right next to each other, why â€“ because of all the complaints. I do not understand the logic behind cramming everyone next to each other for no apparent reason itâ€™s extremely inconsiderate. Iâ€™m on vacation I donâ€™t want to have to wake up when my neighbors wake up. The second morning I woke up to the same scenario but then about 8 am my air conditioner started making a horrible noise. It sounded like someone was in the vent banging on it with a hammer. I shut it off for an hour and tried again but it was still making the noise, and then waited another hour but no such luck. So I called the front desk and asked if I could change rooms, preferably upstairs. This was no problem someone ran over and brought me a key to a room upstairs within minutes. They even offered to help me with my bags (FYI there is no elevator). When I got to the new room it was like I was at a totally different hotel. It was in far better shape than the one downstairs. The shower was clean and the tub drained quickly, but this could be due to the fact that the water coming out of the shower head in this room only came out like a slow drip. Weâ€™re talking zero water pressure. Although I didnâ€™t have to worry about people pounding around on the ceiling, I had the most obnoxious neighbors on both sides of me. The one to the left kept their front door open with the TV blaring all evening. When the door was shut, they came in and out every 15 minutes to smoke. I could hear every word of every conversation on both sides of me. I didnâ€™t wake up to the sounds of the building cracking my third morning just the sounds of vacuum cleaners. When housekeeping is in your neighbors room it sounds like they are in your room. The air conditioner started making the same noise as before around 9 am. So in conclusion, if you end up staying here and have any problems the staff will work with you to solve them, but how many times do you want to do that? If they didnâ€™t cram their guests together when they had the space to scatter them, they would get at least 1 extra star probably even 2 because I wouldnâ€™t have had half the problems that I did. If youâ€™re hard of hearing and like to wake up at the crack of dawn then this is the place for you. If however you have the hearing of a dog and like to sleep in until there is at least double digits on the clock then I suggest you go elsewhere. Now I have to drive six hours home tired and cranky.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly Adequate Hotel with Exceptional Staff”
Reviews.Author: jazzycheetah
Reviews.Content: Ended up going to San Diego on a convention weekend with friends and needed a last minute hotel that wasn't $500+ a night. This place was a bargain, had an available room, and was in a good location. The rooms are nothing spectacular (they're what you would expect from a budget hotel) but they were clean and well kept. One of the big pluses for me was that the staff was extremely polite and helpful. The location near the Old Town transit station was also great in that it took ~3 minutes to walk to and provided transport to anywhere we wanted to go in the city. All-in-all, it was a fine experience and definitely top-choice when it comes to bargain hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay for comfort,service,and unbeatable price”
Reviews.Author: skycheese
Reviews.Content: Excellent location for walking to shops and food places in old town and trolley. The management is exceptional for service. Have been coming here for years whenever we come to San Diego. Rooms have always been very clean and comfortable and their rates have always been great. I recommend to make reservations ahead of major events or festivals so you won't be disappointed because at Padre Inn I am sure they fill up before any other place due to their rates and outstanding place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good location - Close to Seaworld and Old Town”
Reviews.Author: miles4us
Reviews.Content: We stayed here while visiting San Diego area to tour San Diego State University, but while there for the tour, we also visited Seaworld. This hotel fit our budget and it was a decent place to stay. Walking distance to Old Town, which was fun for us to go to on our first day/night there. The next day, we went on our tour to SDSU, which was about 20 minutes away on the freeway. After SDSU we grabbed lunch at In-n-Out (took it back to the hotel and ate it in the pool area.) and headed to Seaworld for the evening shows. Seaworld was offering a 2-day for the price of 1-day admission, so we went back the next day for all of the daytime shows. It was nice to split the Seaworld visit into two days. We reserved two rooms, right next to each other, but not connecting. (We wanted internet and the connected rooms did not have wireless.) Problems: Sinks/Tubs backed up the first day and were fixed the next morning and one of my kids found a long, lock of hair (ewww) in the room. Positives: The staff was nice and the local police seemed to enjoy the attached coffee shop, so we felt very safe. We did not try the coffee shop.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely no complaints--a good basic room at a good basic price.”
Reviews.Author: etalius
Reviews.Content: As a resident of San Diego for many years and now frequent visitor I can tell you that this hotel is an excellent value. Yes, it's a little dated and yes, very basic, but it's clean and the staff are friendly and accomodating. Since it's close to the I-8 entrance I thought it would be noisy but it turned out to be very quiet and I slept like a log. The location is excellent: walking distance to Old Town and to the trolley, easy access to other areas of interest, and plenty of parking. At under $60 it's a real find in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for the price”
Reviews.Author: LorrainaMaria
Reviews.Content: This is one of the most reasonable motels in town if you want a place that is centrally located with clean, quiet rooms and helpful management. I've stayed in a lot of other places in San Diego at comparable prices (in Mission Valley, for example) and this is by far the best. It's not the Hyatt, but then you are not paying $200 a night either. We stayed for 5 nights, and had no complaints whatsoever.

Reviews.Title: “Good budget motel”
Reviews.Author: Jay_LeeSanDiego_CA
Reviews.Content: Having found the PadreTrail Inn in the AAA approved listing I booked into this motel in spite of some negative reviews. I am unable to understand their experience. Our experience was just fine. The motel is very modestly priced considering its good location. We found it clean and we were well treated by reception. I would certainly go there again. For those who want more class they will have to pay accordingly.

Reviews.Title: “Complete Dump”
Reviews.Author: phasmatidae
Reviews.Content: The Padre Trail Inn's website looked good, and the price made me think that it would be a decent place. Boy was I wrong. It is a complete dump. Everything is old and stained. I had thought that perhaps the stains were just that and it wasn't actually dirty until I made the mistake of looking under the bed. I found drugs in addition to other trash and lots of dust. The water temperature fluctuates wildly in the mornings (from scalding to freezing) making showering very unpleasant. The wireless Internet doesn't work. The plumbing is very noisy and it's difficult to have a conversation if someone is taking a shower or flushing the toilet in the next room. I paid 1/3 the price and had a much better experience at the Super 8 on Hotel Circle...

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: bigrig_driver
Reviews.Content: This is an older type of a hotel but I found their customer service to be great and there's lots of things to do in the neighbourhood. A decent Mexican restaurant is across the street; and the hotel is easy to get to via Interstate.

Reviews.Title: “Very average motel, high price”
Reviews.Author: E-TripCalifornia
Reviews.Content: The Padre Trail Inn was a very average low-end motel with 1970s fixtures and a dirty pool, but decent bedding and otherwise clean. Would have been fine for $75/night, but their summer $150 rate was extreme. Otherwise, staff was nice and location was close to the center of Old Town.

Reviews.Title: “Circa 1970 No Tell Motel!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I spent two days at the Padre Trail Inn with my adult children, we had to laugh to keep our spirits up. This place is fairly clean, but a dump. Ants in the room, woke up sharing my bed with them. The rooms are all designated as non-smoking, but to get to your room you have to crawl past the other guests smoking on the stairway. The television was on the blink, the water in the shower had no regulator (hot one second, cold the next). The cost to stay for two nights was close to $300 and that was at least $175-200 too much. Definitely not worth the money!

Reviews.Title: “The ONLY place to stay in San Diego!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My experience was wonderful! I will stay there from now on when I visit San Diego. The staff there really know how to treat a guest in the most hospitable way. I felt like a king! They will go way out of thier way to see that your every wish is fufilled. The property is great. Very clean and comfortable, as well as Affordable !

Reviews.Title: “Don't waste you money!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: While I realize that looking for an inexpensive, yet convenient place to stay in San Diego is a bit challenging, you would be better off to rent a car and sleep in it. Not only did online pictures and descriptions not give an accurate portrayal of this hotel, they were a gross sense of false advertising. The pool which is supposedly located in the palm tree filled courtyard is actually situated nicely between a large area of parking lot and the nearest highway. You may be a little late to the pool if you are busy sleeping in on the hard beds. I realize that this may be hard to do though, if you bed is shaking at 7 am in the morning because of the jackhammers at the large construction site next door, or if the hotel maintenance decides that trimming the bushes at 8 am is a good idea as well. Top this off with unresponsive staff who would not bring us toilet paper because they didn't want to leave the office at the hour of 11 pm and the on-site American style restaraunt that cost us just over $30.00 for 4 of us to have scrambled eggs and toast! I would highly recommend that you find another location for your vacation. If perhaps the other prices are too much for you, which is understandable, then I heard that Florida is a nice place to go!

Reviews.Title: “Would never stay here again”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I would never stay here again. Unresponsive mgt. Domestic fight in adj room 5/28/04, Mgt did not move them after complaint. Same problem 6/31/04, no response w/Mgt; called SD City Police, they responded. SD Police comment to me "You do understaqnd that this is the Padre Trail Inn". 6/30/04 9:00am drunk sleeping on sidewalk by motel office.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Great location and easy access to Old Town's restaurants, shops and museums. Rooms are clean. However, front desk personnel could improve on the reception of guests. All annemities were not present as stated in their advertisement. A quite place to relax.

Reviews.Title: “Good basic lodging w/ excellent location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Rated above average because of convenience of location. This is a average middle-tier motel where the amenities are not particularly obvious. It is right across the street from Old Town, San Diego's best Latin food. It is three blocks from the Old Town trolley station, which is a 10-15 minute trip into downtown and the Convention Center. If you are on a budget and attending a conference at the Convention Center or have business downtown, this is a perfect place to stay.If you make reservations at night, confirm with the day shift as my only complaint was disorganization at the front desk.

HotelInfo.Name: Americas Best Value Padre Trail Inn
HotelInfo.Address: 4200 Taylor Street, San Diego, CA 92110
